heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 28 September 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 10.5°C), outside temperature (down 9.2°C), and inside temperature (down 2.8°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 7392 lux) and cloud levels (up 362 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 7970 lux) and cloud levels (up 407 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 362.4m lower than yesterday, 407.0m lower than the past week, 281.5m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 821m minimum and 3400m maximum, with an average of 1432.5m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1839.5m and 1714.0m.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, the air will feel dry and calm and still conditions are expected. Showers, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and weak sunlight because of clouds. Similar weather conditions should remain.

washing.phrase: Make your own mind up as there is not enough information from the weather station.
